snippet: Churchill Downs, which is set to host the 141st running of the Kentucky Derby on May 2, has banned the pole-like contraptions that allow people a longer reach to snap their self-portraits.
abstract: Churchill Downs bans selfie sticks, poles that allow people to take self-portrait photos from farther than arm's reach, as safety measure for horses as well as people at upcoming Kentucky Derby.
lead_paragraph: Churchill Downs, which is set to host the 141st running of the Kentucky Derby on May 2, has banned the pole-like contraptions that allow people a longer reach to snap their self-portraits.
